SECRET.
G.T. 1336.
WAR CABINET.
MESOPOTAMIA COMMITTEE - FUTURE ADMINISTRATION.
(Note by the Secretary.)
The Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs has proposed that the War Cabinet should consider the question of extending the powers of the Mesopotamia Committee of which Lord Curzon is Chairman, so as to enable it to deal with other questions such as Arabia, Hedjaz, etc.
(Sgd.) M.P.A. HANKEY.
2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.
July 9th. 1917
